title: Declaring a Crime Emergency in the District of Columbia
summary: The document is an executive order (14333) issued by the President on August 11, 2025, declaring a crime emergency in the District of Columbia. The order highlights the severe rise in violent crime, which is disrupting federal operations and endangering public safety. Key statistics include a homicide rate of 27.54 per 100,000 residents in 2024 and the highest vehicle theft rate in the nation. The order mandates the use of the Metropolitan Police Department for federal purposes, with operational control delegated to the Attorney General. Regular monitoring and updates on the emergency conditions are required, with provisions for further action if necessary. The order aims to restore law and order, ensuring the safety of federal workers and the efficient functioning of government.
